intro: Hieracium pseudacroleucum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous root system. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along riverbanks.
